Crimes.Crime_Type: Human Rights Violations and Serious International Law Offenses
Crimes.Dispute_Type: Refugee claim based on lack of state protection
Crimes.Outcome: Application allowed, case remanded for redetermination
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Inadequate state protection against domestic abuse
Crimes.Evidence_Requirement: Claimant must prove state protection is unavailable
Crimes.Institutional_Action: Police failure to respond to repeated abuse reports
Crimes.Government_Body_or_Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada
Crimes.Jurisdiction: Canada (Federal Court review of refugee claim)
Crimes.Temporal_Context: 15 years of abuse, recent flight from Saint Lucia
Crimes.Geographic_Context: Saint Lucia (country of origin), Canada (asylum country)
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Whether state protection was reasonably available
Crimes.Governing_Body: Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada
Crimes.Complaint_Issues: Lack of police intervention in domestic violence
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Burden of proof on claimant to show inadequate protection
Crimes.Protection_Claim: Need for international protection due to state failure
Crimes.State_Protection_Assessment: Inadequate due to persistent police inaction
Crimes.Risk_Factor: History of severe domestic violence and near-fatal incident
Crimes.Credibility: Credible and consistent testimony supported by evidence
Crimes.Risk_Nature: Serious harm including death or extreme physical injury
Crimes.Enforcement_Action: No effective enforcement despite multiple reports
Crimes.Perpetrator_Entity: Intimate partner with history of violence
Crimes.Legal_Basis: Well-founded fear of persecution due to state inability to protect
Crimes.Victim_Basis: Gender and membership in a particular social group

Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to Provide Protection by Police
Crimes.Violation_Type: Failure of state authorities to provide protection
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Adequacy of state protection in domestic violence cases
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant reported abuse five times; no police action taken
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Board’s decision set aside, case remanded
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Refugee status based on lack of domestic protection
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Unreasonable reliance on unsupported claims of improved policing
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Female refugee claimant from Saint Lucia
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Repeated police inaction despite formal complaints
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Gender-based persecution and lack of state response
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Claimant must demonstrate state protection is ineffective
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Frequency and severity of abuse, responsiveness of authorities
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Improper evaluation of evidence by the Board
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Claimant found credible; corroborated by pattern of abuse
Crimes.Application_Basis: Fear of persecution due to domestic violence and lack of redress
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Board failed to properly weigh evidence of systemic failures
Crimes.Governing_Rule: State protection must be both available and effective
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Board relied on speculative improvements without evidence
Crimes.Outcome: Application granted, referred back for re-determination
Crimes.Decisional_Body: Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Near-fatal strangulation, ongoing threat upon return
Crimes.Cause_Description: Fled after nearly being killed due to lack of police protection
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Contrary evidence ignored by the Board
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: Right to life and security under international norms
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Selective use of evidence favoring state performance
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Not applicable – claim based on pre-flight conditions
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Evaluation of foreign state protection within Canadian refugee determination
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Insufficient and unbalanced assessment by the Board
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Unreasonable conclusion given documented police failures
Crimes.Decision_Making_Body: Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Overreliance on generalizations, dismissal of specific incidents
Crimes.Legal_Standard_Applied: Whether protection is accessible, effective, and enforceable

Crimes.Threat_Source: Abusive partner with history of physical violence
Crimes.Mitigating_Factors: None noted – perpetrator not held accountable
Crimes.Prior_Criminality: Pattern of unreported and unpunished abuse
Crimes.Evidence_Sufficiency: Sufficient – consistent testimony and reporting history
Crimes.Evidence_Credibility: High – detailed, consistent, and plausible narrative
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Accepted as truthful by the Court
Crimes.Risk_Assessment: High risk of serious harm or death if returned
Crimes.Targeted_Victimization: Yes – sustained abuse over many years
Crimes.Legal_Framework: International refugee law and Canadian domestic implementation
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: Fear of persecution due to membership in a particular social group (women in Saint Lucia unable to access protection)
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Claim accepted for reconsideration; original decision overturned
Crimes.Outcome: Case remanded to a different member of the Board
Crimes.Procedural_Issues: Improper evaluation of credibility and country conditions
Crimes.Legal_Procedure: Federal Court review of refugee determination
Crimes.Decision_Maker: Immigration and Refugee Board (initial), Federal Court (review)
Crimes.Government_Body_Involved: Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada
Crimes.Review_Mechanism: Judicial review under Rule 388 of the IRB Rules
Crimes.Authority: Federal Court has supervisory jurisdiction over IRB decisions
